We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value. 

Which digit is the largest?

$\greenD9$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\greenD9$ will be in the hundreds place: 
 $\greenD{9}$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD4$.  

  So  $\blueD4$ goes in the tens place:  

$\greenD{9}$$\blueD4$ $\_$

The smallest digit is the $\purpleC2$.  The  $\purpleC2$ goes in the ones place:  

$\greenD{9}\blueD4\purpleC2$

The greatest possible number we can make is $\greenD{9}\blueD4\purpleC2$.
